channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Calls For Calm, and a Defiant Trump Prepares for the R.N.C.
item.description: Plus, how cord blood banks mislead parents.

item.title: The R.N.C. Begins
item.description: The latest on the assassination attempt and presidential campaign — plus, an explanation of why childbirth has gotten so expensive.

item.title: Omega owner Swatch Group’s moment has passed as profits drop 70% in 6 months: ‘The big impact is really mainly China’
item.description: The company’s key Omega brand may be suffering from more availability of models at retail from rival Rolex, the top Swiss watch brand.

item.title: How to Watch the Republican Convention
item.description: Former President Donald J. Trump is scheduled to accept the G.O.P. nomination during the four-day gathering in Milwaukee.

item.title: Israel Struck Twice in Its Attack on Al-Mawasi, Videos and Photos Show
item.description: Visual evidence from Saturday’s strike in Gaza that left dozens dead appears to show that the Israeli military launched a separate strike near emergency vehicles.

item.title: Qualcomm sues China’s Transsion, the ‘Smartphone King of Africa,’ for infringing on its patents
item.description: Transsion has almost half of Africa's smartphone market and the company is expanding in South Asia and other emerging markets.

item.title: The Book Bag That Binds Japanese Society
item.description: No rule requires Japan’s elementary school students to wear the boxy, bulky backpack known as the randoseru. But for nearly 150 years, nearly all of them have.

item.title: The Book Bag That Binds Japanese Society
item.description: No rule requires Japan’s elementary school students to wear the boxy, bulky backpack known as the randoseru. But for nearly 150 years, nearly all of them have.

item.title: Thailand is trying to create a ‘whirlwind’ in its economy with a $14 billion program that includes handouts to almost anyone over the age of 16
item.description: An estimated 50 million Thais 16 years and older are qualified to receive 10,000 baht ($276) each under the so-called digital wallet scheme.

item.title: Protesters Are Expected to March in Milwaukee as R.N.C. Opens
item.description: After the attempted assassination of Donald Trump, protest organizers said their rally would proceed as expected. Law enforcement authorities said they were prepared.

item.title: What’s Greenest and Cleanest When Nature Calls?
item.description: Conventional toilet paper has a big environmental impact. We’ve got the lowdown on alternatives, from bamboo tissue to bidets.

item.title: ‘Football is seldom ever just about sports’—this year’s European Championship demonstrated how waves of immigration have redefined sports
item.description: Young footballers of color such as Nico Williams and Barcelona’s 16-year-old Lamine Yamal still face personal abuse.

item.title: Trump Survived the Violence, and May Benefit From It
item.description: Six political effects of the attempted assassination.

item.title: With Rivals Restricted, Kagame Looks Set for Another Term in Rwanda
item.description: The Central African nation is voting on a potential fourth term for President Paul Kagame. Opposition figures say they have been threatened and arbitrarily detained.

item.title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott slams power company CenterPoint as 270,000 homes and businesses remain without power after Hurricane Beryl
item.description: “Power companies along the Gulf Coast must be prepared to deal with hurricanes, to state the obvious,” Abbott said at his first news conference about Beryl.
